quests.title: Getting Started
quests.text: Welcome to Craft to Exile! This progression log aims to provide you with some direction as to where to go next. For starters, it's recommended that you do some light exploring in the Overworld just as you would normally, and to set up camp. Please make sure to redeem your rewards as you progress!

quests.title: The Crux
quests.text: You may have noticed the bag in your inventory - right click to use it. In Craft to Exile, equipment is mainly acquired by killing mobs. Crafted equipment can be used, but the power will be limited. Dropped equipment scales with the mob level, so the stronger the mobs the better the equipment! Try to kill some skeletons (not Nasty skeletons!) - hopefully you'll find a new piece of equipment.

quests.title: Getting Stronger
quests.text: As you fight mobs and complete quests, you will earn experience. Once enough experience is gained you will level up and become stronger. Upon leveling, you will earn stat points, skill points, and talent points. Press H to access the Mine and Slash hub to distribute your points, and customize your character accordingly! Do not worry about messing up your stats as reset potions are available later in the game.

quests.title: The Bumblezone (Optional)
quests.text: Craft to Exile is focused around a dimension progression system. While you could stay in the Overworld until level 30, The Bumblezone is a recommended zone for level 14-18. The recommended levels for each dimension are as follows: Overworld (1-30), The Bumblezone (14-18), Nether (16-26), The End (26-30), Atum (30-40) Good Night's Sleep (40-50), Midnight (50-58), Tofu World (58-66), Maps (30-99). To get to the Bumblezone, throw an Enderpearl at any Bee Nest or Beehive. You can leave the Bumblezone by digging down or climbing above Y = 256.

quests.title: Ores
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, special ores spawn in the overworld. These important ores have different rarities and can be used to repair equipment or craft special items. Check JEI for more information.

quests.title: Currency Items
quests.text: Currency items are powerful items with the ability to reroll the stats on your equipment. In order to use them, you must craft a modify station.

quests.title: Broken Swords
quests.text: With the use of a repair station, you can repair equipment using ores. Additionally, capacitors can be attached to repair stations to improve ore repair efficiency. Note: common ores are VERY inefficient, you should use at least uncommon ores.

quests.title: Upgrading Your Equipment
quests.text: With a modify station, you are able to upgrade or reroll your equipment using currency dropped by mobs. Craft one soon!

quests.title: TOO. MUCH. LOOT.
quests.text: Are you having issues with hoarding loot? Look no further! You can craft a salvage station to turn unused equipment into ores! Note: this will not work with crafted equipment.

quests.title: Still Too Much...
quests.text: You can craft currency and equipment bags that will automagically pick up currency and equipment for you, while providing additional storage while adventuring. Check the JEI for the crafting recipe!

quests.title: Bzzzy Beez
quests.text: Welcome to The Bumblezone! Here you'll find a plethora of biomes filled with honey, bees, and more! Explore The Bumblezone and return with all the sweets! But beware, taking honey from bees may involve risks...

quests.title: Stop The Buzz
quests.text: You're probably getting real annoyed by the bees... So let's get rid of some!

quests.title: Stop The Buzz 2
quests.text: There are so many different bee types here... Exterminate!

quests.title: Feeling Sweet
quests.text: Sugar water is Bumblezone-specific and can be stored in a bottle. Drinking sugar water will restore a small amount of hunger and increase your movement speed.

quests.title: Bittersweet
quests.text: And thus, our journey in the hive comes to an end. But the bee's legacy may last forever. Honey slimes are special slimes that can generate honey similar to how a sheep produces wool. Hint: you can find altars of assorted honeycomb in caves in The Bumblezone.

quests.title: The Nether Regions
quests.text: At level 20, you'll be able to take on the Nether. Craft an obsidian portal to access the Nether - you'll be able to take the same portal back to the Overworld. Enter the Nether and stop the Demon Lords from invading the Overworld!

quests.title: Stay Safe
quests.text: The Nether is a lava-filled zombie pig-infested area. Be careful not to dig straight down.

quests.title: All Your Bases
quests.text: Craft to Exile includes the fantastic MineColonies mod which will allow you to establish a home 'base'. In a MineColonies, you will act as the leader and oversee production of new facilities and ensure that citizens remain happy. Get started by crafting the building tool. From this point on, you will build your buildings by right-clicking with the tool. The wand will auto-detect any building blocks you have in your inventory.

quests.title: My Tent
quests.text: The supply camp is the first thing you need to a successful establishment. Although not functionally useful, the supply camp is required since it will provide you with a town hall. It is important to choose your first location for your town hall wisely. You will need a large flat area for your entire colony (the town hall must also be on flat ground). You will notice that right-clicking with the supply camp (the supply camp does NOT require using the building tool) allows you to visualize where you can put your supply camp.

quests.title: Work Work
quests.text: Finally, some citizens from the town hall! To start actually building buildings, you will need to establish a builder's hut. Place the builder's hut with your building tool and  one of your citizens will become a builder. Make sure to feed your citizens well! Explore the building options on JEI, or visit the MineColonies wiki for more information.

quests.title: End Game
quests.text: Congratulations. You're in the end game now! The max level is 99. Good luck!

quests.title: Oooh Shiny
quests.text: A villager in town is really addicted to unique ores and materials. Help them out by finding 50 quartz!

quests.title: Glowing Skin
quests.text: Now that you've given them quartz, they know you're capable of traversing the Nether! They've asked you to go back and bring them 30 glowstone blocks!

quests.title: Warts
quests.text: After sleeping with the glowstone and licking quartz, the poor villager has come out with a terrible case of warts. They've heard that nether wart can be a quick-fix cure and have asked you to bring them some nether wart!

quests.title: Aquaculture
quests.text: Aquaculture is a fantastic mod that enhances the vanilla fishing experience. Follow this questline to see what Aquaculture has to offer!

quests.title: So Long...
quests.text: Craft yourself a tackle box if you want to be a true fisherman. A tacklebox will allow you to customize your fishing outfit and hold onto various fishing items!

quests.title: Hooker
quests.text: Hooks can enhance your fishing rod with various effects. Iron hooks will increase your fishing rod durability. Try out other hooks to see their benefits!

quests.title: Rodular Upgrade
quests.text: Higher tier fishing rods will increase your chances at catching better fish and have increased durability!

quests.title: For All The Fish
quests.text: Neptunium is an ore specific to Aquaculture. You can craft really powerful fishing rods and accessories with neptunium.

quests.title: What The Blaze?
quests.text: The Nether has a plethora of enemies to encounter and many unique biomes. Hopefully, when you come across blazes you won't be so scorched.

quests.title: Who Cut Cheese?
quests.text: The Nether is an unforgiving realm. You're likely to shed tears from frustration. But did you know monsters in the Nether can cry too?

quests.title: Withering Away
quests.text: As you traverse the Nether, darkness starts to gnaw at your psyche. Quickly, we must get out of here! Kill the withers and grab their skulls. Only then can we leave...

quests.title: Black Death
quests.text: Finally, assemble 4 blocks of soul sand/soil in a T shape and THEN place the 3 wither skeleton heads on top, and kill the Wither! But be warned, it won't be easy!

quests.title: Light In The Shadows
quests.text: Remember that villager? Yeah, they're back... Seems like warts weren't enough to get them off shiny objects. This time they're asking for nether stars... THREE of them!

quests.title: The End
quests.text: With an Eye of Ender, you can locate a stronghold in the Overworld that will let you access The End. Be sure to bring 12 Eye of Enders with you to activate the portal. Get ready... The End is near.

quests.title: End Of An Era
quests.text: You made it! You're at The End! Woo- *GRUMBLE GRUMBLE* what the?! Is that a dragon I hear?

quests.title: The Ender Dragon
quests.text: Kill the Ender Dragon.

quests.title: End Remnants
quests.text: With the Ender Dragon gone, you should revisit The End and explore the islands that are left. Maybe you'll find a special chest or something along the way...

quests.title: Back To The Nether
quests.text: After returning to the village, you heard rumours about villagers constantly having nightmares. According to a bar keeper, villagers have resorted to consuming mushrooms which seemed to have a 50% success rate at deterring the nightmares. Find the mushrooms in the Nether and see what you can do about the nightmares.

quests.title: Pharaoh-cious
quests.text: You hear sleepless whispers of the undead rising - fear pierces every village in the Overworld. It seems like it's time to take a trip to Atum - the desert of the dead.

quests.title: Blissful Awakening
quests.text: Lucky you! You've accessed the Good Dream dimension, where you'll find unicorns and rainbows. You sense that something is wrong with the balance of positive and negative energy. If you'd like, use positite or negatite gems to craft a luxurious or wretched bed to access the respective dimension directly. You will automagically leave the dream dimensions after 20 minutes.

quests.title: Sleep Paralysis
quests.text: How unfortunate. You've accessed the Nightmare dimension, where you'll find demons and darkness. You sense that something is wrong with the balance of positive and negative energy. If you'd like, use positite or negatite gems to craft a luxurious or wretched bed to access the respective dimension directly. You will automagically leave the dream dimensions after 20 minutes.

quests.title: Point The Way
quests.text: Waystones is a mod that allows the player to teleport between waystones using warp stones or scrolls. They can be found naturally spawning around the world in large towers. It is possible to rename or configure the waystone into a global waystone. Global waystones can be teleported to interdimensionally. The warp stone allows you to teleport to any waystone at a cost. It has a longer cooldown than using scrolls.

quests.title: Show Me The Way
quests.text: Scrolls are a fast way of teleporting to a waystone. They are one-time use, but cheaper and faster than warp stones.

quests.title: Direct Me The Whey
quests.text: Warp scrolls are consumables that let you teleport to a waypoint. You could also use a warp stone, but warp stones have long cooldowns and are more costly to use.

quests.title: Hit Them Where It Stings
quests.text: These brood zones seem to be where the bees are being produced. Destroy the blocks and harvest the honey for yourself.

quests.title: Slimey Means
quests.text: Honey slimes are a great 100% honey. Kill them and harvest the honey!

quests.title: Barbarian Raids
quests.text: Occasionally, your colony will be faced with barbarian and pirate raids. You should have established a guard tower already, but if your forces are overwhelmed, then you'll need to defend your colony yourself!

quests.title: Exploring Fiery Depths
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Squashing Bugs
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Burning Hides
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Heebie Jeebies
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Firebolt!
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: And The Brain
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Finding The Source
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Lords Of The Underworld
quests.text: Asmodeus and Rahovart serve the Wither. Summon Asmodeus and Rahovart in the Nether by constructing their altars using the soulcubes (refer to wiki).

quests.title: On The Hunt
quests.text: The Endermen are hindering your ability to safely traverse The End. Clear out the remaining Endermen in The End.

quests.title: Squashing Bugs II
quests.text: It seems that The End and the Nether have some sort of connection. However, these trites seem to have undergone some sort of void transformation.

quests.title: What Are These Anyway?
quests.text: These morbid undead beings feed on dead energy. Due to the unstable energy they possess, they explode upon death. Be careful!

quests.title: And The Brain II
quests.text: Kill these creatures in The End to prevent some from leaving the void and into the Overworld.

quests.title: Firing That Lazer
quests.text: Kill these creatures in The End to prevent some from leaving the void and into the Overworld.

quests.title: Make Your Bed
quests.text: Making a luxurious bed using your positite gem will allow you to freely access the Good Dream dimension without worrying about having a nightmare.

quests.title: In A Daze
quests.text: It's very peaceful in this dream world. It's to try to find clues first. Try harvesting natural materials to analyse their components.

quests.title: Unicorns...
quests.text: Perhaps killing the most pure creature will provide hints...

quests.title: Candyland
quests.text: Sweet ore? Maybe it's connected to the nightares... Definitely. Mine some and smelt them into candy to find out... for science.

quests.title: ... And Rainbows!
quests.text: This multi-coloured ore has red in it! It has red in it! Must be evil.

quests.title: Staying Positive
quests.text: Positite gems radiate with positive energy. Perhaps collecting a few of these will help us understand how to restore balance.

quests.title: Sweet Tooth
quests.text: Since we're here, let's harvest some of the natural sweet foods of the realm... Starting with lolipops! Harvest lolipops from the lolipop bushes.

quests.title: Seeds To Happiness
quests.text: Harvest some rainbow seeds by breaking the grass. You can plant these seeds to harvest rainbow berries!

quests.title: The Full Arch
quests.text: Rainbow berries are delicious, filling, and pretty to look at. That's really it though!

quests.title: Make Your Bed II
quests.text: Making a wretched bed using your negatite gem will allow you to freely access the Nightmare dimension.

quests.title: In A Haze
quests.text: Find your bearings in this nightmare realm. Find and harvest planks native to this area to find out more about how the Nightmare dimensions works.

quests.title: The Source Of The Undead
quests.text: After analysing the various wooden planks, you find out that they're imbued with undead energy. Find the source of the undead energy in the underground.

quests.title: Zits Are Evil
quests.text: Ever since arriving in the Nightmare realm, you notice your acne has gotten worse. Zitrite is believed to be increase 'acne-causing' radiation levels. Get rid of it!

quests.title: Negative Karma
quests.text: You sense a great disturbance in the balance of positive and negative energies. Harvest negatite gems - maybe you can do something with the positite and negatite gems.

quests.title: Flame On!
quests.text: Lava monsters can be found in most dimensions that have lava. They're not very cool!

quests.title: Unpleasantries
quests.text: Spectres freely roam between dimensions and wreak havoc on the psyche of any living organism. Wherever they go, they bring with them misfortune. Find them and destroy them.

quests.title: Dream Eaters
quests.text: Reapers feed on the spiritual energy of the dead. However, they may mistaken a sleeping being as a dead one, and will attempt to harvest their energy in their sleep. Reapers come from The Midnight dimension - accessible only once someone has seen death. Find some reapers and kill them; absorb their energy and find out how to access The Midnight

quests.title: Eternal Darkness
quests.text: The Midnight is an endgame dimension that is difficult to access, and survive. Find a large heap of malignant red plant blocks in the Overworld - these will spawn a portal at night that allows you access The Midnight. Be warned though, you cannot come back through the portal unless it 's night time in the Overworld as well.

quests.title: Optimization Algorithms
quests.text: Putting capacitors into repair stations is a great way to be more efficient with your ores. Did you know better capacitors are even more efficient?

quests.title: The Master Bag
quests.text: Combining the three bag types will produce the master bag!

quests.title: Beastiary I
quests.text: You'll find these unique zombie creatures in snow and desert biomes. Your task is to kill the eskimo zombies with spears and the ancient mummies, which both are rare variants of the non-spear and non-ancient zombies.

quests.title: Beastiary II
quests.text: Pandora's Creatures brings unique mobs to the Overworld. One of which is a powerful spider mini-boss that can be found in plains or mountain biomes.

quests.title: Beastiary III
quests.text: Better Animals Plus brings a whole slew of creatures that blend in with the Overworld. If you haven't noticed, many of these creatures are tameable and mountable. The Hirschgeist is a powerful skeletal deer that is immortal during the day, and hostile at night. You can find the Hirschgeist in forested biomes, or you can summon it by craft a hand of fate. Light the hand of fate with flint and steel, then offer a cut of raw venison, an antler, and a nether wart (in any order)

quests.title: Beastiary IV
quests.text: Rotten Creatures is a mob-centric mod that brings powerful zombies to the Overworld. You probably have already encountered some, especially if you've completed Beastiary I. The Immortal and Deadbeard are two powerful boss zombies. The Immortal can be found in the Overworld during thunderstorms, and Deadbeard can be found in beach biomes. Note: these two spawns are extremely rare.

quests.title: Beastiary V
quests.text: On the outer islands of The End, you will find guardians that defend massiive structures. Be careful though, these golem-like creatures pack a punch.

quests.title: Beastiary VI
quests.text: These grotesque creatures can be found in prisons in The End. Be warned... for they were locked up for a reason.

quests.title: What's The Date?
quests.text: Craft to Exile offers seasons to add more complexity to farming. With Serene Seasons, Simple Farming, Pam's HarvestCraft 2, and Cooking for Blockheads, the farming and cooking experience is more complex and enjoyable. To start off, it's a good idea to craft a calendar, which will tell you what the current season is. By doing so, you can plant the seeds at the optimal time. Off-season crops will grow slower than in-season crops - keep this in mind when making your farm!

quests.title: Milkin' It
quests.text: Milk is an essential ingredient to most cooking recipes, including cheese. Milk a cow using a bucket. Did you know that eating unique foods will permanently increase your health? Get to cookin' (use'/foodlist size' to see how many foods you've eaten)!

quests.title: Gouda Job!
quests.text: Cheese is used in a lot of recipes in Simple Farming. But you'll notice that there is no way to craft a cheese slice. That's because to get a cheese slice, you must place a wheel of cheese down and click it (similar to cake).

quests.title: A Recipe For Disaster
quests.text: You're probably feeling overwhelmed by all the possible foods you can make. Don't worry! You can just farm and worry about cooking later with the recipe book 'Cooking for Blockheads I'! By using the book, you can see which foods you can make with the things you have in your inventory.

quests.title: Food Storage
quests.text: With all the foods you have, you might need to look for a storage solution. Luckily, Cooking for Blockheads allows you to build a fully functional kitchen (did you know the sink provides infinite water!?).

quests.title: Upgrading Your Kitchen
quests.text: It was mentioned before that you can upgrade your kitchen, so we're going to do exactly that. The oven enables smelting abilities in your kitchen - try it out!

quests.title: The Possibilities!
quests.text: While 'Cooking for Blockheads I' can be mighty useful, sometimes you just want to see all the available recipes (and without scouring JEI). You can make an unfiltered recipe book to look at available foods to cook!

quests.title: Back To The Chopping Board
quests.text: The cooking table functions similar to the oven, but provides your kitchen with crafting abilities.

quests.title: I Can't Carry Anymore
quests.text: Sometimes you just want the good old fashioned travel storage solution.

quests.title: Your Engineering Degree
quests.text: Immersive Engineering is a tech mod that is included with Craft to Exile. Once you've familiarized yourself, feel free to delve into IE. Use the manual to assist you when uncertain about certain functions. Remember that IE ores only spawn in the mining dimension!

quests.title: Rift Seeker
quests.text: Rifters are prominent in The Midnight. Perhaps killing them will give you a clue as to how to get back.

quests.title: Richard Rider
quests.text: The nova is a creature that can be easily mistaken for ores. What even makes them float?

quests.title: This Ain't The Bumblezone
quests.text: These tiny scorpion-looking things have enough venom in their stingers to kill you in 10 seconds... If you don't do anything.

quests.title: From The Shadows
quests.text: Don't be deceived by the adorable look these creatures can give you. They say skulks bring more misfortune to those they cross than black cats. Be warned, skulks have the ability to blend with their surroundings.

quests.title: Stick To The Basics
quests.text: You sense power emanating from everything - even the trees. Fetch some sticks and maybe the source of power can be analyzed.

quests.title: Obsidian?
quests.text: Nightstone is native to The Midnight. Rumours have it that if you stare into nightstone for too long, you'll succumb to eternal darkness.

quests.title: Bad Kind Of Shroom
quests.text: Rock on! These shrooms look radical... Let's bring some back for SCIENCE.

quests.title: Midnight Rifts
quests.text: Ebonite ore literally stands for black ore. It's even darker than nightstone, so it's probably a good idea to grab what we need and leave.

quests.title: Pitch Black
quests.text: Nagrilite possesses a unique characteristic: it's dark and shiny!

quests.title: Tenebrum
quests.text: Tenebrum: darkness. Once forged, the darkness in this metal aborbs light, making it impervious to holy attacks.

quests.title: Mapping Device
quests.text: The mapping device opens portals to a dungeon realm. In this realm, you are unable to place or break blocks... So tread carefully. Always bring teleportation scrolls with you in case you get stuck! To use the mapping device, place it in an flat and open space. Fill it up with ores (fuel), then take the map in your hand and use it on the mapping device. Good luck!

quests.title: The Grand Hempening
quests.text: Hemp is vital to starting Immersive Engineering. You can find hemp seeds in grass.

quests.title: Crafting Equipment
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, it is possible to craft equipment. Feel free to craft equipment if you're in a bind. Crafted equipment follow a progression system as well. In general, equipment from stronger dimensions are for higher levels. For more information please visit the wiki.

quests.title: Shield Hero
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, you can craft shields if you need an offhand item in a pinch. Crafted shields follow a loose pipleline: shield -> honey crystal shield -> heavy plated shield -> rockshroom shield.

quests.title: Sweet Retribution
quests.text: The honey crystal shield is unique to The Bumblezone and should suffice up until level 40 (you'll need to craft a new one every few levels)!

quests.title: Mining Dimension
quests.text: The Mining Dimension is an endless cave that can be accessed by crafting a teleporter (see JEI). It's recommended that you're at least level 30 before entering the Mining Dimension.

quests.title: Enter Maps
quests.text: Congratulations on finishing the main quest line! From now, you are free to level however you want. The max level is 99!

quests.title: Storage Solutions
quests.text: Storage Drawers is a mod that makes sorting your loot a lot easier! Use storage drawers to label and autosort your items, and more! Visit the wiki to see the full capabilities of Storage Drawers!

quests.title: Shared Experience
quests.text: If you're having problems teleporting back to your body then I have the solution for you! XP blocks are craftable blocks that can store experience. They can even be shared with other players!

quests.title: Sleeping On The Job
quests.text: Can't deal with mobs at night while travelling? Tired of lugging an entire bed frame? Craft the sleeping bag and sleep whenever, wherever! Some conditions may apply.

quests.title: Spice of Life: Carrot Edition
quests.text: Eating unique foods will give you a small bonus to HP. Use the food book or /foodlist (requires permissions) to track your progress.

quests.title: Tools Of The Trade
quests.text: Pam's HarvestCraft 2 brings many different and new foods to flesh out Spice of Life. Many of the foods require specialized tools.

quests.title: Make Me A Sandwich
quests.text: Well? Make me one!

quests.title: Start Creating
quests.text: Create is a modular low-tech mod that brings functionality in pieces. Your imagination is the limit! Andesite alloy is required for Create's basal structures. Please note: Create ores spawn in the Overworld, while Immersive Engineering ores only spawn in the Mining Dimension!

quests.title: Get Shafted
quests.text: Shafts are used in many apparatuses. Use shafts to connect Create conveyer belts or to place blocks on. Shafts relay rotation in a straight line!

quests.title: Inventing The Wheel
quests.text: Use cogwheels to relay rotation to other cogwheels. Stick them on a shaft and see what happens when coupled with a power source.

quests.title: Flattening Up
quests.text: The mechanical press compresses items beneath it. It can turn iron ingots into iron sheets. It requires constant rotational force.

quests.title: Keep Things Going
quests.text: The belt connector can be used to attach 2 or more shafts. The belt can move both items and entities.

quests.title: Delivery
quests.text: The extractor is a useful device that takes items from an inventory and places them onto the ground (or a conveyor belt).

quests.title: Reception
quests.text: Similar to the extractor, except that attaching this to a chest will instead pick up items from a belt.

quests.title: Give Me Power!
quests.text: Your first main source of power! Craft a water wheel and place under flowing water. Then attach it to the mechanical press to provide rotational power!

quests.title: See More, Do More
quests.text: Engineer's goggles, when worn, will let you see more details about create blocks when you look at them. A must have!

quests.title: Assessing Speed
quests.text: When attached to kinetic components, it will display the rotational speed.

quests.title: Assessing Stress
quests.text: When attached to a kinetic network, it will display the overall stress.

quests.title: Your First Job
quests.text: Iron sheets are basic components of various Create structures. Place an iron ingot beneath a mechanical press that is powered by rotational force. Turn it on using a lever and make sure that you 'drop' the iron ingot below the press!

quests.title: A Wrench In Your Plans
quests.text: A useful tool that can be used to rotate, dismantle, and configure contraptions.

quests.title: Light Show
quests.text: An important item used in various Create recipes.

quests.title: Making Brass
quests.text: When paired with a basin beneath it, the mechanical mixer will allow you to combine copper and zinc ingots with blaze powder to make brass ingots. However, you will need more rotational power for the mixer. Place smaller cogwheels diagonally next to large cogwheels and they will rotate at higher speeds than the large cogwheel. You can place a large cogwheel on the same axis as the small cogwheel and repeat the pattern to increase your RPM. However, doing so will increase stress on the machinery and as a result you can run less devices simultaneously on the same source of power. Note: you will need to have also completed the 'Mining Dimension' quest in Act III to access the next quest.

quests.title: Crude Blast Furnace
quests.text: Steel is the basic building block of all things IE. But to make steel, you'll first need a crude blast furnace. Consult the manual for the layout of the blast bricks. You will need an engineer's hammer

quests.title: Coke Oven
quests.text: Coke coal is more efficient than regular coal and is used in a blast furnace. You will need an engineer's hammer.

quests.title: Wire We Not Connected?
quests.text: Wires connect an electricity source to a capacitor - which can disperse energy to nearby contraptions. You will need a wire cutter to remove any unwanted wires.

quests.title: Creating A Line
quests.text: Use a wire coil to place down wires. It's fine to start with copper, but you can look into upgrading your wires later.

quests.title: Establishing Contact
quests.text: Before you can even connect wires to anything, you will need to place wire connectors on the blocks themselves.

quests.title: Capacitor
quests.text: Capacitors are required to store energy which can be funneled to various contraptions. Attach the capacitor to an energy source such as the Create water wheel.

quests.title: RPM Conversion
quests.text: In order to utilize rotational power from Create, you will need to convert it into power that IE understands. Use the dynamo to convert rotational power into RF. You will lose some power in the conversion.

quests.title: Improving The Wheel
quests.text: Now seems like an appropriate time to start on a redstone flux generator. RF is the power source that IE uses. Craft a kinetic dynamo - this will be attached to IE's water wheel.

quests.title: Big Wheel
quests.text: Place the water wheel onto a kinetic dynamo near a large water fall. Be sure to connect it to a capable capacitor.

quests.title: Applications
quests.text: The furnace heater can be placed next to a furnace. When provided with sufficient power, the furnace can run without fuel.

quests.title: Welcome To Atum
quests.text: Atum is a desert dimension filled with evil mummies and treasure. Reach Atum by constructing a shallow 3x3 pool of water surrounded by sandstone blocks. Place 2 sandstone blocks in each corner to form 4 pillars. Then throw a scarab into the pool of water.

quests.title: Surveying The Locals
quests.text: Due to the lack of resources, Atum is in constant disarray. Not to mention, the desert flows with undead energy...

quests.title: Creepy Crawlies
quests.text: Tarantulas can be found all over Atum at night (and other sandy biomes). Are they stronger than vanilla spiders?

quests.title: Nomad's Land
quests.text: Nomads are the natives of the desert and will attack on sight. They are aggressive towards other creatures, too.

quests.title: Someone's Out To Get Us
quests.text: After fighting the nomads, we learnt that there are pyramids in Atum which contain great treasures... However, it seems like someone caught wind of us trying to find this treasure.

quests.title: Guardians Of The Stone
quests.text: Even the land has been infused with negative energy. Be careful when mining stone - rumours mention the stone coming back to life...

quests.title: Ghosts Of The Desert
quests.text: First mummies and now we have to deal with ghosts too?!

quests.title: Followers Of Atum
quests.text: You've been told that the pyramids hold great treasure - but that great treasure is guarded by an ancient pharaoh. Interrogate some followers and find out how you can get to the treasure.

quests.title: The Pharaoh
quests.text: You learn from the bandit warlord that you need to find the pharaoh's sarcophagus and surround it with royal torches. You can find the sarcophagus deep in the pyramids.

quests.title: Strange Sands
quests.text: These sands are more coarse than the sands from the Overworld. Grab some so that you can inspect it more closely.

quests.title: Limestone?
quests.text: Limestone is the most abundant type of rock available in Atum and is therefore used in many structures.

quests.title: Sandtraptions
quests.text: The kiln is made of limestone and functions similarly to the furnace. You will also want to make a spinning wheel to process threads.

quests.title: Finding An Oasis
quests.text: The oasis is a biome found in Atum that is untouched by the undead energy. You can find water and grow crops here.

quests.title: Threading The Needle
quests.text: Because of the sun and the never-ending heat, locals have adapted to use thin linen clothes for protection from both the heat, and terrors.

quests.title: Desert Protection
quests.text: Locals realized that linen clothes were not enough to protect themselves from enemies, and learned to incorporate rare metals into their clothes for extra protection.

quests.title: Disenchantments
quests.text: In Atum, you can craft disenchanting scrolls which will let you remove enchantments from your equipment. Combine these with the equipment in a crafting table.

quests.title: Nocturnal Whispers
quests.text: After killing the Pharaoh, you hear a whisper, 'it is too late, for my energy has seeped from Atum into the realm of dreams... I'll be back.' Go to the dream dimension and find the true source of negative energy.

quests.title: To The Top
quests.text: Tired of climbing slow ladders or walking up to the waystones on the towers? Craft stone ladders to get to the top faster! Upgrade your stone ladder to go even faster!!!

quests.title: Beastiary VII
quests.text: Summon and elimnate the Amalgalich by crafting the undead portal (refer to wiki). It is not recommended that you face the Amalgalich alone...

quests.title: Summoning Aspect
quests.text: Complete this quest to unlock the summoning quest tab. Summoning from Lycanites Mobs is fully supported in Craft to Exile. Summons will scale off of your level and your damage stat. In CtE, you can only summon the primal elementals. However, it is possible to summon 2 elementals at a time and have them fuse into the a more powerful elemental. Press the beastiary (default: G) to change which elemental is equipped to the summon slot, and hold right-click with the staff to open a portal to summon the elemental.

quests.title: [CURRENTLY UNATTAINABLE] Staff of Quantity
quests.text: Use the savage summoning staff to summon twice as many elementals with half as much health.

quests.title: [CURRENTLY UNATTAINABLE] Staff of Quality
quests.text: Use the stable summoning staff to summon elementals that stay by your side for a longer duration.

quests.title: Air
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the djinn at high altitudes in most dimensions.

quests.title: Earth
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the geonach when mining ores in the advanced mining dimension.

quests.title: Water
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the jengu in deep caverns of water in the Good Dream dimension.

quests.title: Fire
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the cinder in the Nether - where you'll find flames.

quests.title: Order
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the aegis protecting your villages in the Overworld.

quests.title: Chaos
quests.text: In order to summon a creature, you must have it in your beastiary (default: G). The greater your knowledge of the creature, the more powerful they become. Fuse elementals to create stronger elementals! Find the argus where you'll find chaos - kill many elementals in close proximity and you may spawn them. Alternatively, find the argus in The End.

quests.title: Ocarina Of Time
quests.text: The Ocarina is a powerful lasso-like tool that can be crafted. By sneaking and right-clicking a friendly entity you can 'claim' the entity. Right-click again to bring the entity to you. This item can only bind one entity at a time. Be careful! Due to technical limitations, you must keep your mount near you. If it's left in a chunk that gets unloaded, it's possible to lose your mount!

quests.title: Bufflon Mounts
quests.text: The bufflon is a unique mountable animal introduced by Pandora's Creatures. They can be customized using specialized bufflon saddles found in The End. However, upon completion of this quest, a basic bufflon saddle will be provided for you. The bufflon can be found in cold and snowy biomes, and can be tamed using herb bundles.

quests.title: Home Decor
quests.text: Craft to Exile includes a few decorative mods such as Macaw's, EmbellishCraft, Mr. CrayFish's Furniture Mod, and Mapper Base. Craft the items to receive a sample of bitumen. You can use bitumen to craft asphalt. Alternatively, you can use put it in the furnace to turn it into common ore.

quests.title: Town Hall
quests.text: In your supply camp, you will find a town hall block in one of the storage units. Place the town hall in a large, flat, open space using your builder tool (the yellow wand). Do NOT place it down as a block or it will not work. Upon placing down the town hall, some citizens will come to your colony. You must next build a builder's hut to assign the task of building to one of your newly recruited citizens.

quests.title: I'm A Lumberjack And I'm OK
quests.text: Now that you have some citizens and a builder's hut, you may find it easier to assign the task of wood gathering to one of your citizens. The lumberjack's hut is where the lumberjack will go in between chopping down trees. The lumberjack will cut down any tree in an approximate 150 block area (from themselves) that is not in a hut schematic and doesn't have cobblestone placed beneath it.

quests.title: It's All MINE!
quests.text: The mine is where the miner will mine for ores and materials. Once they are hired, the miner will create a shaft downward and then branch out.

quests.title: Guardians Of The City
quests.text: The guard tower will employ and house 1 guard to protect your colony. The new guard will need a bed in a house in order to spawn. However, once they are hired at the guard tower, that becomes their new residence and the bed in the house will open up for another new citizen (child or recruit). Note: If you place guard towers near your colony border and level them up, your border will expand.

quests.title: Fishy Food
quests.text: The fisherman's hut is where the fisherman will catch fish. The fisherman requires a fishing rod and a body of water of a minimum of 7 blocks wide x 7 blocks long x 1 block tall to be able to work. The water must also be near the hut.

quests.title: Getting Schooled
quests.text: The university is where a researcher will research various upgrades to your colony. Once you click on a research tree, you will see the options for each research branch. Each option will tell you the requirements and how long it takes to research that option (time is real-world time spent in-game). Each column of a research branch is also the level the university needs to be to begin a research from that column.

quests.title: Population Density
quests.text: The citizen's hut is a house for your citizens. They will go to the citizen's hut they are assigned to at night to sleep. It's also one of two ways to get more citizens for your colony (the other being the tavern). For additional citizens to spawn, you first have to have enough space in your citizen's hut(s) to house your first four citizens. After you have created enough space for your initial four citizens, you have two options for your colony to grow. The first way is to have at least one citizen's hut at least level 2 that houses a male and a female citizen, which will allow a child to be born in the colony when there is room. You can also make space for a new citizen, go to the tavern, wait for a traveler to show up, and then give them the items they request to recruit them.

quests.title: Have A Beer
quests.text: The tavern is like a citizen's hut in that it houses citizens. However, the tavern houses four instead of one and can't be upgraded to house more. Every so often, travelers will come to the tavern. You can recruit these travelers (with items) to live and work in your colony. Note: The tavern can only be upgraded to level 3, not level 5. You can also only have 1 tavern per colony.

quests.title: Centripetal Force
quests.text: The centrifuge is a powerful device that can turn your honeycombs into valuable resources.

quests.title: Stocking Up
quests.text: Using the centrifuge, it is possible to extract ender pearls from ender honeycomb. You're going to need some later on, so you may as well convert it now!

quests.title: None Of Yo Beeswax
quests.text: You'll notice that using the centrifuge produces a by-product known as beeswax. I wonder... what can you do with it?

quests.title: Finding The Right Ores
quests.text: Immersive Engineering ores can only be found in the mining dimension. Go spelunking and stock up while you're there!

quests.title: Finding The Right Ores
quests.text: Teleporting back from maps can be a little glitchy. Use teleport scrolls to guarantee a safe and precise return.

quests.title: Identification, Please
quests.text: You'll often find unidentified equipment that need to be identified before you can see its stats. Identify tomes are consumable items that do identify the top-right-most unidentified item in your inventory.

quests.title: Forsaken
quests.text: Once revered, the ghosts of the past have come to haunt those who have forgotten them. That is, unless you can remove them first.

quests.title: Tofu..?
quests.text: After all that work... you hear murmurs of death coming from a world made of tofu... Find soybean seeds in the Overworld from grass and make tofu. You can put tofu into the furnace to obtain grilled tofu.

quests.title: Making The Tofu Portal
quests.text: To get to Tofu World, you will need to make a 3x3 well (1 block deep) out of grilled tofu. Ensure that it's completely surrounded. Pour soymilk from a bucked into the well, then right click it with a tofu stick. Good luck in the Tofu World. Don't be deceived by the cute critters!

quests.title: A Blank Canvas
quests.text: Welcome to Tofu World! Don't be deceived by the local fauna, this place is creeping with enemies! Start out by exploring your surroundings.

quests.title: Tofu Research
quests.text: The Tofu World brings many different types of tofu to Craft to Exile. Think of tofu not only as a food, but as a resource. You can use it like wood or in some cases, even ores.

quests.title: Is Everything Made Of Tofu?
quests.text: Continue exploring the world and try to harvest everything you see. You'll be surprised at what you can find! Consult the JEI if you're ever confused about recipes.

quests.title: Diamond In The Rough
quests.text: Some tofu is inherently very strong. You'll find a deep cavern system in Tofu World. Here, you may find diamond tofu!

quests.title: All Purpose
quests.text: You'll quickly learn how truly versatile tofu is!

quests.title: Defend And Retaliate
quests.text: TofuCraft even brings new shields and a new bow to Craft to Exile!

quests.title: Tofu Strength
quests.text: Craft a full set of diamond tofu armour and be amazed at how strong it is!

quests.title: Tofu Or Slime?
quests.text: Native to the Tofu World, these tofu slimes look awfully similar to the green slimes found in the Overworld. Are they slime, or tofu?

quests.title: Old Friends
quests.text: You're starting to notice a pattern here...

quests.title: Cute Critters
quests.text: I said to NOT get deceived by the cute creatures!

quests.title: Slime Locator
quests.text: This device will point you to the nearest slime. Or was it tofu?

quests.title: Tofu With Teeth
quests.text: Well this is new. These creatures have pretty sharp-looking chompers. They don't seem too friendly.

quests.title: Chaotic Evil
quests.text: You've heard the local tofunians are quite wealthy...

quests.title: Dispelling Evil Tofu
quests.text: In the end, the source of the tofunian displeasure was a tofu... guardian this entire time. Looks like it was a false alarm. Let's go kill the gandlem and put this to rest.

quests.title: You Can Eat Tofu Too
quests.text: TofuCraft brings about many new foods that use tofu as the main ingredient. Eating tofu will count towards your Spice of Life bonus hearts!

quests.title: Mochi!
quests.text: Make zunda mochi with a rice ball and zunda! Zunda can be made from sugar and boiled edamame.

quests.title: Helicopter Goes SoySoySoy
quests.text: Soy milk is often used in TofuCraft food recipes. It's best to stock up on it when it's so abundant!

quests.title: Morijio
quests.text: This delicate looking dish MUST be useful!

quests.title: Fukumame
quests.text: Consider this quest entry the end-game of TofuCraft... Just kidding. You went the wrong way!

quests.title: Tasting Salt In The Air
quests.text: The salt furnace is used in the production of tofu. Place the salt furnace under a cauldron, fill the cauldron with water, and provide a fuel source to the salt furnace. You will begin to harvest salt. You can also harvest bittern with an empty bottle from the leftover water in the cauldron. This is the main ingredient to making tofu! Use the bottle of bittern on soy milk to turn it into tofu!

quests.title: Archery Specialization
quests.text: Quivers are a special item in Craft to Exile that hold arrows. Arrows placed in the quiver are used first. If you remove the quiver then the arrows in the quiver will automatically dispense into your inventory.

quests.title: Seed Market
quests.text: The market is a special block that allows you to exchange emeralds for seeds. It is extremely useful, especially if your base is in a desolate biome.

quests.title: Fertilization
quests.text: Farming for Blockheads introduces 3 different coloured fertilizers that each have unique properties. Green fertilizer improves the yield from a harvest, yellow fertilizer prevents the crop from being trampled on, and red fertilizer improves the speed at which the crop grows. Right-click with the fertilizer (consumed) on tilled soil to apply their effects!

quests.title: Automated Feeding
quests.text: The feeding trough is a block that can hold foods and auto-feed nearby animals. Place it down and place food into the trough to see its effects! The trough covers an 8x8 block area and can each feed 8 animals at simultaneously.

quests.title: Egg Collector
quests.text: The egg collector automatically collects chicken eggs in an 8x8 block area.

quests.title: Eight Legs
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, there are 3 different defense types. Plate, leather, and cloth. Plate provides armor and health, leather provides dodge and health, and cloth armor provides magic shield. Armor reduces incoming damage, dodge gives you a chance to evade an enemy attack, and magic shield adds to your life pool.

quests.title: Double Double Toil And Trouble
quests.text: During your travels, you will come across 2 types of off-hand equipment: shields and torches. Shields can be used to reduce oncoming damage by holding right-click. They function a little differently from vanilla shields (these also work too, though). Torches can be used to regenerate mana and energy. Do not mistake these for vanilla torches that provide light!

quests.title: Taking The Long Route
quests.text: Eventually, you'll need to get to the Nether if you want to progress in Craft to Exile. Craft flint and steel, and make a Nether portal out of obsidian to access the Nether!

quests.title: Mistakes Were Made
quests.text: If you've looked at the talent tree and skill trees, it's easy to be overwhelmed by the number of choices. Luckily, Craft to Exile makes it easy to reset your skills and stats by making reset potions available for crafting. Try crafting the stat reset potion and I'll give you the other reset potions, free!

quests.title: Cave Lighter
quests.text: You can craft a mining helmet to assist you while spelunking. It gives off light as you move!

quests.title: Friends Forever
quests.text: The telepass is a special item that unlike other items, offers no benefit to yourself. It allows other players to teleport to you as long as you're in the same dimension and online. The gold telepass is one-time-use and the diamond variant has 10 uses.

quests.title: Handyman
quests.text: The tool belt is a useful tool that occupies the Curios belt slot. Press the tool belt key (default: V) to access the radial menu! Right click while holding the tool belt to view which tools are currently equipped on the tool belt.

quests.title: Handyman+
quests.text: The tool belt by default only comes with 2 slots. That's not nearly enough for all of your tools! Upgrade your tool belt using an anvil with a pouch to increase the number of tools you can have equipped.
